title: Possible useless `cmp` instruction not removed
body:
I tried this code:

```rust
pub fn foo(v: Result<String, String>, f: fn(String) -> Vec<u8>) -> Vec<u8> {
    v.map_or_else(f, f)
}
```

I expected to see this happen:

The compiler generates the same instructions as:

```rust
use std::convert;

pub fn foo(v: Result<String, String>, f: fn(String) -> Vec<u8>) -> Vec<u8> {
    f(v.map_or_else(convert::identity, convert::identity))
}
```

Instead, this happened:

See <https://godbolt.org/z/sbTETdYxK>, an extra `cmp` instruction is generated.

```diff
  example::foo:
          push    rbx
          sub     rsp, 32
          mov     rbx, rdi
+         cmp     qword ptr [rsi], 0
          mov     rax, qword ptr [rsi + 24]
          mov     qword ptr [rsp + 16], rax
          movups  xmm0, xmmword ptr [rsi + 8]
          movaps  xmmword ptr [rsp], xmm0
          mov     rsi, rsp
          call    rdx
          mov     rax, rbx
          add     rsp, 32
          pop     rbx
          ret
```

### Meta

`rustc --version --verbose`:

```text
rustc 1.71.0-nightly (521f4dae1 2023-05-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 521f4dae1bdf7fe9cf9436ecef9ee7c7442708bf
commit-date: 2023-05-19
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.71.0-nightly
LLVM version: 16.0.4
Compiler returned: 0
```
